publicComment: ABB reports emissions in Scope 1, Scope 2, and Scope 3 for the years 2023 and 2022. The company uses the market-based method for calculating Scope 2 GHG emissions. Biogenic CO2 emissions are included in a separate category. Despite detailed reporting across several categories, some specific data is missing, warranting further review, especially concerning potential inconsistencies in Scope 3 categories.
reviewComment: The company has reported conflicting numbers in scope 3 compared to what could be expected and what is concluded in the totals. This needs further review.
agentResponse: Thank you for the additional information. I have updated the Scope 3 emissions for 2023 to 436346000 tonnes as per your input. Please review the complete data and confirm if any other adjustments are needed.

publicComment: ASSA ABLOY reports emissions in Scope 1, Scope 2, and Scope 3. For Scope 1 (direct emissions) they reported 67,009 tons CO2e for 2019 and reduced to 59,495 tons CO2e in 2023. Their indirect energy-related emissions (Scope 2) decreased from 205,309 tons CO2e in 2019 to 166,908 tons CO2e in 2023. Scope 3 emissions, representing 99% of their total carbon footprint, include categories such as purchased goods and services, use of sold products, and transport and distribution. For 2023, Scope 3 emissions totaled 16,629,181 tons CO2e. The company uses activity-based methods for calculating Scope 3 emissions and is working to improve data quality. They have set targets for significant emission reductions and have action plans to achieve their Scope 3 goals by 2030.
agentResponse: The scope 1 emission value for 2023 has been updated to 59495 tons. Please review the updated data.

description: ASSA ABLOY is a global leader in access solutions, dedicated to improving security and convenience for businesses and consumers. The company specializes in the production of locks, door closers, entrance automation, and related solutions.

publicComment: ASSA ABLOY reports emissions in Scope 1, 2, and 3. For Scope 1 and 2, the reported emissions were 59,495 tCO2e for direct energy use (Scope 1) and 166,908 tCO2e for indirect energy use (Scope 2) in 2023. For Scope 3, the total reported amount was 16,629,181 tCO2e in 2023, covering categories Purchased Goods and Services (3.1), Use of Sold Products (3.11), End of Life Treatment of Sold Products (3.12), Upstream Transportation and Distribution (3.4), Downstream Transportation and Distribution (3.9), Fuel and Energy-Related Services (3.3), Employee Commuting (3.7), Business Travel (3.6), and Waste Generated in Operations (3.5). The company has made significant progress in reducing energy consumption and intensity metrics for water, hazardous, and non-hazardous waste, and shows a decrease in total greenhouse gas emissions related to energy consumption with increased focus on addressing Scope 3 emissions. Their goals include energy efficiency and process changes to achieve long-term climate targets.
reviewComment: The company has reported conflicting numbers in scope 3 compared to what could be expected and what is concluded in the totals. This needs further review.

reviewComment: The report does not provide specific information about the company's Scope 1, Scope 2, or Scope 3 emissions. This data would greatly enhance the transparency and completeness of the report.
publicComment: Addnode Group AB has highlighted its commitment to digital solutions that promote sustainability, particularly in public transport through the Rebus tool, leading to significant environmental benefits including an estimated 90 percent reduction in GHG emissions per trip compared to car travel. However, the report lacks specific data on the company's own Scope 1, Scope 2, and Scope 3 emissions and does not set any explicit targets for achieving net zero emissions. Including these details would improve the quality and comprehensiveness of the report.

publicComment: Addtech's reporting of greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions for the fiscal year 2022/2023 includes detailed data for Scope 1, Scope 2, and Scope 3. The Scope 1 emissions amount to 2,446 ton CO2e, primarily encompassing emissions from the company's vehicle fleet and fuel combustion. Scope 2 emissions are reported both location-based (3,887 ton CO2e) and market-based (4,273 ton CO2e). Scope 3 emissions, which total 34,103 ton CO2e, include upstream and downstream transportation (30,353 ton CO2e), business travel (3,667 ton CO2e), and fuel-related activities (83 ton CO2e). The total emissions for the year are 40,436 ton CO2e with a CO2 intensity of 2.16 ton CO2e per MSEK in revenue. Addtech's reporting provides a clear and detailed overview of emission sources, showing improved transparency compared to previous years.

factors.description: Nitrous Oxide (N₂O) to CO2e conversion factor

publicComment: Arla rapporterar sina utsläpp enligt GHG-protokollet och har delat in dem i tre scopes. Under 2023 var företagets totala CO₂e-utsläpp 18,801 tusen ton enligt marknadsbaserad metod och 18,841 tusen ton enligt platsbaserad metod. Scope 1-utsläppen, som innefattar direktkontrollerade aktiviteter som produktion och transport, uppgick till 508,000 ton CO₂e. Scope 2-utsläppen från inköpt energi var 152,000 ton (marknadsbaserad) och 192,000 ton (platsbaserad). Scope 3-utsläppen, som inkluderar indirekta utsläpp från bland annat inköpta varor och tjänster, transporter och avfall, stod för 18,141,000 ton CO₂e. Arla har satt vetenskapligt baserade mål med en minskning av scope 1 och 2-utsläpp med 33% jämfört med 2015. Företaget har också långsiktiga klimatmål att nå netto nollutsläpp senast 2050. Deras rapportering visar även framsteg inom Scope 3-utsläppen med en minskning av CO₂e per kilo mjölk och vassle från 1,29 kilo 2015 till 1,14 kilo 2023. Arla har vidtagit flera åtgärder, inklusive energioptimeringar och investeringar i förnybar energi, vilket bidragit till att minska deras totala klimatpåverkan.

reviewComment: AstraZeneca reports its emissions across Scope 1, Scope 2 (market-based and location-based), and Scope 3 according to the GHG Protocol. Inconsistencies in data visibility for earlier years, especially in scope 3 subcategories. The report will benefit from verifying calculations, especially with changes in GWP values for years such as 2016 vs 2020. The inclusion of biogenic and Scope 1 emissions needs more clarity, and certain Scope 3 categories lack granular data.

publicComment: Atlas Copco Group reports its greenhouse gas emissions across Scope 1, 2, and 3. Their reporting tool, The Product Carbon Footprint tool (PCF), calculates carbon footprints through entire product lifecycle phases, although significant uncertainty remains in their data which Atlas Copco acknowledges and aims to improve. All emissions were provided in metric tonnes of CO2 equivalent (tCO2e). Scope 2 emissions reported for both location-based and market-based measures. Scope 3 categories beyond those detailed were included within an 'Other' category. Data consistency and clarity were found present, but continuous improvements are proposed.
agentResponse: Based on your update, the information for 2023 regarding Scope 1, Scope 2, and Scope 3 emissions has been corrected accordingly.

publicComment: Atrium Ljungberg reports its CO2 emissions according to the Greenhouse Gas Protocol, covering Scope 1, 2, and 3. Their total emissions for 2023 reported were 11 752 tons CO2e based on the market-based method, showing a 13% decrease from the previous year. Emissions data cover various categories such as purchased goods and services, capital goods, fuel- and energy-related activities, waste generated in operations, and business travel, among others. Biogenic emissions are specified separately and were excluded from the GHG totals. Negative emissions or offsets were also not included, adhering to the provided instructions. The Scope 2 location-based value appears significantly higher in comparison to the market-based value, which calls for further review and validation.
reviewComment: The Scope 2 location-based emissions for 2023 are considerably higher than market-based values. Additional review and validation are needed.

reviewComment: The company has reported conflicting numbers in scope 3 compared to what could be expected and what is concluded in the totals. This needs further review.
publicComment: Avanza rapporterar utsläpp i Scope 3 från kategorierna Inköpta varor och tjänster (98 ton CO2e för 2023), Kapitalvaror (229 ton CO2e för 2023), Bränsle- och energirelaterade aktiviteter (7 ton CO2e för 2023), Uppströms transport och distribution (2 ton CO2e för 2023), Avfall genererat i verksamheten (2 ton CO2e för 2023), Affärsresor (1 ton CO2e för 2023), Anställdas pendling (7 ton CO2e för 2023), och Uppströms leasade tillgångar (12 ton CO2e för 2023). Företaget har totalt rapporterat utsläpp om 494 ton CO2e för 2023 (lokationsbaserat) och 490 ton CO2e för 2023 (marknadsbaserat). Avanza har satt mål att reducera sina utsläpp med 50 procent till 2030 och att nå nettonollutsläpp av växthusgaser senast 2040. Företaget följer riktlinjerna från Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi) och investerar aktivt i klimatlösningar med hög positiv miljöpåverkan.

publicComment: Axfood reports emissions data with high detail for Scope 1, Scope 2, and Scope 3. In 2023, the total emissions amounted to 2,719,922 tons CO2e. Direct emissions (Scope 1) were 12,225 tons CO2e, and market-based Scope 2 emissions were 2,195 tons CO2e. The largest emissions originated from Scope 3, totalling 2,705,502 tons CO2e, with major contributions from food sales and leased transportation. The company aims for net zero emissions from its own operations by 2030. They have taken several measures to reduce emissions, including the use of renewable fuels and electricity, and energy efficiency improvements in their stores and warehouses. Despite these efforts, emissions increased slightly in 2023 due to higher leased transport in line with business growth. Note that some Scope 3 categories lack data for certain years.
reviewComment: The company reported conflicting numbers in scope 3 compared to what could be expected. This needs further review.

goals.description: Klimatredovisningen är ett viktigt verktyg för att identifiera vår påverkan av utsläpp enligt Greenhouse Gas Protocol (GHG).
Intern förbrukning av fordonsbränsle minskat bränslebehovet vid lackering.

factors.description: CO2e per km for delivered vehicles

publicComment: Bilia rapporterar utsläpp i Scope 1, Scope 2 och Scope 3 enligt Greenhouse Gas Protocol (GHG). För Scope 1 noterade bolaget utsläpp på 5865 ton CO2e för 2023, en minskning jämfört med 6513 ton 2022 och 7706 ton 2021, vilket indikerar framsteg inom intern bränsleanvändning och produktion. Scope 2 utsläpp (market based) uppgick till 3150 ton CO2e, en minskning från 4217 ton 2022 och betydligt lägre än 17765 ton 2021, vilket tyder på effektivare elförbrukning och ökad användning av grön energi. Scope 3 utsläpp var omfattande, uppgående till 833976 ton CO2e, en markant ökning från 202528 ton 2022. Företaget har inkluderat nya kategorier under 2023, såsom inköpta varor och tjänster – levererade fordon (276352 ton CO2e), anställdas pendling (5788 ton CO2e), och användningen av sålda produkter – levererade fordon (355650 ton CO2e). Dessa nya kategorier visar på en mer heltäckande rapportering som stärker deras klimatansvarstagande.
reviewComment: The company has reported conflicting numbers in scope 3 compared to what could be expected and what is concluded in the totals. This needs further review.

publicComment: Fastighets AB Balder rapporterar omfattande växthusgasutsläpp för år 2023. Totala utsläpp rapporteras i Scope 1, Scope 2 (både lokal- och marknadsbaserat), och Scope 3, där de största källorna i Scope 3 inkluderar kapitalvaror, bränsle- och energirelaterade aktiviteter, samt uppströms transport och distribution. Viktiga data inkluderar: Totala växthusgasutsläpp på 231 407 ton CO2e (lokalbaserat) och 241 378 ton CO2e (marknadsbaserat), med en minskning från föregående år på cirka 2% respektive 5%. Företaget använder olika beräkningsmetoder inklusive genomsnittsmetod, leverantörsspecifik, hybrid och kostnadsmetod för att beräkna sina utsläpp. Balder rapporterar också biogena utsläpp separat. Förbättrade rapporteringsprocesser, som införandet av ett nytt digitalt system, hjälper till att öka noggrannheten och enhetligheten i hållbarhetsrapporteringen. Företaget fokuserar också på att implementera EU:s hållbarhetsdirektiv CSRD och standarden ESRS, vilket speglar deras engagemang för kontinuerlig förbättring i hållbarhetsarbetet.
reviewComment: The company has reported conflicting numbers in scope 3 compared to what could be expected and what is concluded in the totals. This needs further review.

reviewComment: The company's reporting appears generally consistent, though some discrepancies exist in Scope 3 reporting. Specifically, categories and amounts differ across years, raising concerns about data reliability and completeness. Additionally, total emissions for some years seem inconsistent when compared with category data. Further review and clarification from the company are recommended to ensure accuracy and comprehensiveness of their emissions reporting.

goals.description: Reduce carbon intensity by 50% compared to the base year 2020/2021, in line with the Paris Agreement.

initiatives.description: Create good long-term customer relationships and continue or create new business opportunities through efforts like product quality, longevity, and lifecycle management.
Improve products that can contribute to efficiencies and/or workplace improvements for customers.
Focus on products’ climate footprint and energy efficiency.
Address logistics issues as a priority area.
Ensure safe, secure workplaces and high employee engagement.
Promote leadership development, fair wages, and equal opportunities for all employees.
Provide development opportunities and work-life balance.
Ensure timely deliveries with high quality and sustainability awareness from suppliers.
Follow the code of conduct and monitor compliance, especially in countries with high corruption risks and poor labor conditions.
Support the business model and business culture, including subsidiary employer branding and working environments.
Contribute to local employment opportunities.
Focus on long-term competitiveness, including the ability to continue growing sustainably and profitably, both organically and through acquisitions.
Monitor and report sustainability efforts, including key figures, goals and follow-up in the sustainability area.
Respond to the impact of new legislation in the sustainability area, such as the Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD).

reviewComment: The company has reported conflicting numbers in scope 3 compared to what could be expected and what is concluded in the totals. This needs further review.
publicComment: Lagercrantz Group AB has reported its greenhouse gas emissions for 2022 according to the Greenhouse Gas Protocol. The total emissions for scope 1, 2, and 3 amounted to 20971 metric tons CO2e. Emissions for Scope 1 were 114 metric tons CO2e, for Scope 2 they were 4045 metric tons CO2e, and for Scope 3 (including categories 3, 4, 8 and 9) they were 15812 metric tons CO2e. The company aims to reduce its carbon intensity by 50% compared to the base year 2020/2021, in line with the Paris Agreement. Lagercrantz intends to include more material categories in its scope 3, which is expected to increase the reported emissions. They also have an ambition to set science-based targets for CO2e emissions moving forward.
